org.codemonkey.swiftworldclient
Class WorldClient<T extends WorldContext>

java.lang.Object
  org.codemonkey.swiftworldclient.WorldClient<T>
Type Parameters:
T - A specific WorldContext implementation, such a some game or a simulation.
public final class WorldClient<T extends WorldContext>
extends Object

The World Client class adds a thin layer around the SwiftSocketClient to ease the management of a server-client interaction, or simulation / game state. It does not handle clients or connections, only client messages in the context of a specific world implementation.

The World Client allows us to execute decoded server messages against a known context (your game class for example), so that the executable message can then invoke specific methods on your WorldContext implementation.

This class keeps polling the client for unprocessed messages and executes them when they become available.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema

Constructor Summary
WorldClient(String host, int port, T context)
          Starts a new default swift socket client on the given host and port, executing new messages as they become available.
WorldClient(String host, int port, T context, ClientType clientType)
          Starts a new swift socket client of a specific type (TCP / UDP) on the given port, executing new messages as they become available.

Constructor Detail

WorldClient

public WorldClient(String host,
                   int port,
                   T context)
Starts a new default swift socket client on the given host and port, executing new messages as they become available.

Parameters:
host - The port on which the server should listen.
port - The port on which the server should listen.
context - The context on which client messages are executed against.
See Also:
SwiftSocketClient.SwiftSocketClient(String, int)

WorldClient

public WorldClient(String host,
                   int port,
                   T context,
                   ClientType clientType)
Starts a new swift socket client of a specific type (TCP / UDP) on the given port, executing new messages as they become available.

Parameters:
host - The port on which the server should listen.
port - The port on which the server should listen.
context - The context on which client messages are executed against.
clientType - The type of server ClientType (TCP or UDP).
See Also:
SwiftSocketClient.SwiftSocketClient(String, int, ClientType)
Method Detail

registerClientMessageToServerType

public void registerClientMessageToServerType(int messageId,
                                              Class<? extends ClientMessageToServer> messageType)
Registers a client-to-server message on the given unique identifier on the message socket client, by delegating to SwiftSocketClient.registerClientMessageToServerType(int, Class).

Parameters:
messageId - The unique identifier for this message type.
messageType - A ClientMessageToServer sub type.

registerServerMessageToClientId

public void registerServerMessageToClientId(int messageId,
                                            Class<? extends ServerMessageToClient<?>> messageType)
Registers a server-to-client message on the given unique identifier on the message socket client, by delegating to SwiftSocketClient.registerServerMessageToClientType(int, Class).

Parameters:
messageId - The unique identifier for this message type.
messageType - A ServerMessageToClient sub type.

start

public void start()
Calls WorldContext.initWorld() before starting the server, after which the server starts handling client connections and incoming messages.

Waits for until a connection to the server has been established.

stop

public void stop()
Stops the Swift Socket Server by delegating this call to SwiftSocketClient.stop().

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(ClientMessageToServer serverMessage)
Sends a ClientMessageToServer to the server using SwiftSocketClient.sendMessage(ClientMessageToServer).

Parameters:
serverMessage - The message to send to the client associated with it.
